name: Time-base Corrected Video
summary: A TBC file is an .LDS (LaserDisc Sample) file that has been converted into a PAL or NTSC video using the ld-decode application. It contains a stream of 16-bit unsigned values, each of which represents a single grayscale value. With a significant amount of effort, TBC files can be used to create .MP4 replicas of the video contained on a LaserDisc.
